revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Afoundry |model=EW500 |asin=B016BMLPZE;US; |fcc_date= |is_manuf=No |type=wireless router |fcc_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=MediaTek |cpu1_model=MT7620A |fla1_brand= |ram1_brand= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_usb_num= |serial= |wi1_chip1_brand=MediaTek |wi1_chip1_model=MT7620A |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=RP-SMA |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi2_ant_conn=RP-SMA |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_speed=100M |wan_ports=1 |stock_boot= |stock_os= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_ip=192.168.2.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui=70:3A:D8 |oui_eth=70:3A:D8 }} No FCC ID is on the label. Looks to have an aluminium case..
==Probable specification sources== * [http://www.192ly.com/tui-jian/ew500-tmall.html Per this post], is seems to be running a MTK platform. * The Amazon entry for the device notes it as using MT7620A. * It would seem probable this device is using MT7620A+MT7610E, however, that is not confirmed. The thing also has 5 RP-SMA connectors, which is not congruent with these specifications. * Per a device on eBay, this device has an OUI of 70:3A:D8.
